what: Introduction: Generating AFNI Models with afnireg
title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: afnireg package provides R interface AFNI’s 3dDeconvolve program fMRI analysis. allows specify complex experimental designs HRF models R using fmridesign framework execute using AFNI’s optimized estimation routines. vignette demonstrates construct full fMRI regression model within R translate syntax associated files required AFNI’s 3dDeconvolve program. allows use R’s flexible formula interface HRF specification tools utilizing AFNI final voxelwise model estimation. primary function translation afni_lm().

title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: AFNI installed 3dDeconvolve available PATH. Model specification via fmridesign (event + baseline models). Optional: fmri_dataset input scans mask, use nodata dry run.

title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: Let’s start simple single-run, single-factor design “Building Event Models” vignette.
code: TR <- 2 cond <- c("face", "scene", "tool", "object") NSTIM <- length(cond) * 4  set.seed(123) simple_design <- data.frame(   stim = factor(sample(rep(cond, 4))),   ISI = sample(10:20, NSTIM, replace = TRUE), # Using wider ISI from previous fixes   run = rep(1, NSTIM),   trial = factor(1:NSTIM) )  simple_design$onset <- cumsum(c(0, simple_design$ISI[-NSTIM] + 2)) sframe <- sampling_frame(blocklens = 140, TR = TR)  # Define a contrast con1 <- pair_contrast(~ stim == "face", ~stim == "scene", name = "face_scene")  # Create the event model emodel <- event_model(onset ~ hrf(stim, contrasts = list(con1)),                       data = simple_design,                       block = ~ run,                       sampling_frame = sframe)  # Create the baseline model (B-spline drift) bmodel <- baseline_model(basis = "bs", degree = 5, sframe = sframe)  # Combine into a full fmri_model fmodel <- fmri_model(emodel, bmodel) #> Error in eval(assertion, env): argument "dataset" is missing, with no default # Define the dataset (using placeholder file names) # Note: This requires actual neuroimaging files to run dset <- fmri_dataset(scans = "scan01.nii.gz",                      mask = "mask.nii.gz",                      TR = TR,                      run_length = 140,                      event_table = simple_design,                      base_path = ".") # Assuming files are in the working directory

title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: afni_lm() function takes fmri_model fmri_dataset objects generates AFNI model specification. creates afni_lm_spec object contains: original fmri_model fmri_dataset. generated 3dDeconvolve command string (alm_spec$cmd$cmd). Parsed command line arguments (alm_spec$cmd$cmdlines). Information stimulus timing files, GLTs, etc. Key Translations: HRF Convolution: package performs HRF convolution specified event_model (e.g., hrf(stim) uses HRF_SPMG1) passes resulting regressors 3dDeconvolve via -stim_file arguments. condition level gets stimulus file (e.g., stim[face]_reg.1D). Baseline Model: Regressors baseline_model (, B-spline basis columns) included nuisance regressors via -ortvec argument. Contrasts: R contrasts (like con1 defined pair_contrast) automatically converted AFNI-style general linear tests (GLTs) using -gltsym -glt_label arguments. separate text file generated GLT (e.g., GLT_face_scene.txt).
code: # Note: This requires a valid fmri_dataset object (dset) alm_spec <- afni_lm(fmodel, dset) print(alm_spec)

title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: default, afni_lm sets polort = -1 3dDeconvolve command. disables AFNI’s built-polynomial baseline drift modeling. desired behavior provide drift regressors via fmrireg’s baseline_model (like B-spline model bmodel), including lead redundant collinear regressors. didn’t include drift terms baseline_model wanted use AFNI’s polynomial drift correction, specify polort afni_lm call: However, explicitly defining drift terms R’s baseline_model generally recommended consistency.
code: # Example: No drift in bmodel, use AFNI polort bmodel_no_drift <- baseline_model(basis = "constant", sframe = sframe) # Only intercept fmodel_no_drift <- fmri_model(emodel, bmodel_no_drift)  # Specify polort=2 for quadratic drift alm_spec_polort <- afni_lm(fmodel_no_drift, dset, polort = 2) print(alm_spec_polort)

title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: can pass additional options directly 3dDeconvolve command using options argument afni_lm. accepts list element names correspond 3dDeconvolve flags (without leading -) values arguments flags.
code: # Example: Request statistic and coefficient buckets, disable t-stat output alm_spec_opts <- afni_lm(fmodel, dset,                           options = list(bucket = "stats_afni",                                          cbucket = "coefs_afni",                                         tout = FALSE)) print(alm_spec_opts)

title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: powerful feature ability specify basis functions within event_model directly map AFNI’s built-HRF models (like BLOCK, TENT, SPMG1, etc.). avoids pre-convolution R lets 3dDeconvolve handle HRF modeling using optimized routines. Use afni_hrf() specifier within event_model formula instead hrf(). Refer afni_hrf() documentation 3dDeconvolve help details available AFNI basis functions parameters.
code: # Example using AFNI's BLOCK basis (duration=2, penalty defaults to 1) # Note: Using afni_hrf requires AFNI to be installed for 3dDeconvolve to run emodel_afni_block <- event_model(   onset ~ afni_hrf(stim, basis = "block", durations = 2),   data = simple_design,   block = ~ run,   sampling_frame = sframe )  fmodel_afni <- fmri_model(emodel_afni_block, bmodel) alm_spec_afni_native <- afni_lm(fmodel_afni, dset) print(alm_spec_afni_native)  # Check the command: It should now use -stim_times instead of -stim_file # and specify 'BLOCK(2,1)' as the basis function. #> Skipping AFNI-native HRF example as AFNI availability check is FALSE.

title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: per-trial modulation (e.g., reaction time), use afni_trialwise(), maps -stim_times_IM.
code: # Add a continuous modulator (e.g., RT scaled 0.2–0.8 s) set.seed(123) simple_design$rt <- runif(nrow(simple_design), 0.2, 0.8)  emodel_tw <- event_model(   onset ~ afni_trialwise(rt, basis = "gamma"),   data = simple_design,   block = ~ run,   sampling_frame = sframe )  fmodel_tw <- fmri_model(emodel_tw, bmodel) alm_spec_tw <- afni_lm(fmodel_tw, dset) print(alm_spec_tw)  # The command should include -stim_times_IM for the trialwise regressor.

title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: Nuisance Regressors: baseline_model includes nuisance regressors loaded files (e.g., motion parameters), afni_lm include via -ortvec argument, similar drift terms handled. Censoring: can provide censoring vector (list vectors per run) censor argument afni_lm. generate censor.1D file add -censor censor.1D option 3dDeconvolve command.
code: # Example: Censor the first 5 scans censor_vec <- rep(1, 140) # Start with all scans included (1) censor_vec[1:5] <- 0       # Censor first 5 scans (0)  alm_spec_censored <- afni_lm(fmodel, dset, censor = censor_vec) print(alm_spec_censored)

what: Dry Runs with -nodata and Design Inspection
title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: can validate command generation without data providing nodata = c(nTR, TR). Combine x1D_stop = TRUE write design matrix (.xmat.1D) stop fitting.
code: # Single run of 140 TRs with TR=2 sec alm_spec_nodata <- afni_lm(   fmodel,   dataset = NULL,   nodata = c(140, TR),   x1D_stop = TRUE,   options = list(bucket = "stats_afni") ) print(alm_spec_nodata)  # Then generate files/scripts without executing AFNI: # run(alm_spec_nodata, outdir = "glm_afni_x1d", execute = FALSE)

title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: Set iresp = TRUE afni_lm() AFNI write impulse response estimates afni_hrf() terms.
code: alm_spec_iresp <- afni_lm(fmodel_afni, dset, iresp = TRUE) print(alm_spec_iresp) # Look for -iresp entries paired with -stim_times terms.

what: Generating Files and Running the Model
title: Translating to AFNI 3dDeconvolve
text: afni_lm_spec object, can generate necessary files optionally execute 3dDeconvolve command using run() method. workflow allows define complex models R using afnireg package leverage AFNI’s 3dDeconvolve efficient estimation.
code: # This command will: # 1. Create the output directory 'glm_afni_output'. # 2. Change into that directory. # 3. Write all necessary files: #    - Stimulus files (.1D) for each regressor if using standard hrf() #    - Stimulus timing files (.1D) if using afni_hrf() #    - Nuisance regressor files (.1D) #    - GLT files (.txt) #    - Censor file (censor.1D) if specified #    - The 3ddeconvolve.sh script containing the full command # 4. Execute the 3ddeconvolve.sh script. # 5. Change back to the original directory.  run(alm_spec_opts, outdir = "glm_afni_output")  # To only generate the script and files without running: # run(alm_spec_opts, outdir = "glm_afni_output", execute = FALSE)

text: package depends : - fmridesign: Event model specification - fmrihrf: HRF modeling - fmridataset: Dataset handling

title: afnireg: AFNI Integration for fMRI Analysis in R
text: Native AFNI HRF specifications Trialwise modulation support Automatic contrast conversion GLT format Support multiple HRF basis functions Multi-run designs Censoring nuisance regression

title: afnireg: AFNI Integration for fMRI Analysis in R
text: comprehensive tutorial using afnireg translate fMRI models AFNI’s 3dDeconvolve format, see Getting Started vignette.

title: afnireg: AFNI Integration for fMRI Analysis in R
code: library(afnireg)  # Create an AFNI HRF specification hrf_spec <- afni_hrf(type = "SPMG1")  # Build a model for AFNI model <- afni_lm(   dataset = my_data,   event_model = my_events,   hrf_spec = hrf_spec )  # Run the model in AFNI results <- run(model)

what: AFNI Integration for fMRI Analysis — afni-package
title: AFNI Integration for fMRI Analysis — afni-package
text: file serves main entry point AFNI integration functionality. implementation modularized following files:

title: AFNI Integration for fMRI Analysis — afni-package
text: afni_hrf_specs.R - HRF specifications constructors afni_stim_files.R - Stimulus file creation management afni_build_stims.R - Building AFNI stimulus objects afni_command_generation.R - 3dDeconvolve command generation afni_contrasts.R - Contrast GLT handling afni_construct.R - Construct methods AFNI terms afni_s3_methods.R - S3 methods AFNI term classes afni_lm.R - Linear model interface functions

title: construct an native AFNI hrf specification for '3dDeconvolve' with the 'stim_times' argument. — afni_hrf
code: afni_hrf(   ...,   basis = c("spmg1", "block", "dmblock", "tent", "csplin", "poly", "sin", "sine", "gam",     "gamma", "spmg2", "spmg3", "wav"),   onsets = NULL,   durations = NULL,   prefix = NULL,   subset = NULL,   nbasis = 1,   contrasts = NULL,   id = NULL,   lag = 0,   precision = 0.3,   summate = TRUE,   start = NULL,   stop = NULL )

title: construct an native AFNI hrf specification for '3dDeconvolve' with the 'stim_times' argument. — afni_hrf
text: ... Variables include HRF specification basis Character string specifying basis function type onsets Numeric vector event onset times durations Numeric vector event durations prefix Character string prefix term subset Expression subsetting events nbasis Number basis functions contrasts Contrast specifications id Character string identifier term lag Numeric lag seconds precision Numeric precision convolution summate Logical whether summate overlapping responses start start window sin/poly/csplin models stop stop time sin/poly/csplin models

title: construct an native AFNI hrf specification for '3dDeconvolve' with the 'stim_times' argument. — afni_hrf
text: afni_hrfspec instance class "afni_hrfspec"

title: construct an native AFNI hrf specification for '3dDeconvolve' with the 'stim_times' argument. — afni_hrf
code: # Create SPM canonical HRF specification hrf1 <- afni_hrf(onsets = c(10, 30, 50), basis = "spmg1")  # Create block HRF with duration hrf2 <- afni_hrf(onsets = c(10, 30, 50), durations = 5, basis = "block")  # Create tent basis HRF hrf3 <- afni_hrf(onsets = c(10, 30, 50), basis = "tent",                   start = 0, stop = 20, nbasis = 10)

text: create afni_lm spec

title: create an afni_lm spec — afni_lm
